criteria: Understanding of the Use of Money
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of the concept of exchange.
Student demonstrates a minimal understanding of the concept of exchange, with significant misconceptions.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of the concept of exchange, but struggles to apply it in different contexts.
Student demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of the concept of exchange, with some ability to apply it.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of the concept of exchange and can apply it in most contexts.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the concept of exchange and can apply it effectively in various contexts, including complex scenarios.
Student demonstrates no understanding of the use of money to purchase goods and services.
Student demonstrates a minimal understanding of the use of money, with significant misconceptions.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of the use of money, but struggles to explain its function in purchasing goods and services.
Student demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of the use of money, with some ability to explain its role in transactions.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of the use of money and can explain its role in purchasing goods and services effectively.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the use of money and can explain its role in complex economic transactions and financial systems.
Student cannot apply the concepts of exchange and money to real-world scenarios.
Student attempts to apply the concepts but demonstrates significant difficulty and misunderstanding.
Student can apply the concepts to simple real-world scenarios with some prompting.
Student can apply the concepts to common real-world scenarios with minimal prompting.
Student can apply the concepts to various real-world scenarios effectively.
Student can apply the concepts to complex and novel real-world scenarios with insightful analysis and understanding.
